meanings.definition: A person who moves restlessly or aimlessly from place to place.
meanings.sent1: The gadders wandered through the park, never staying in one spot for long.
meanings.sent2: The group of gadders roamed the streets, exploring every corner of the city.
meanings.sent3: The gadders accidentally ended up in the wrong neighborhood, but they quickly found their way back.
meanings.sent4: She was a social gadders, always seeking out new friends and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The gadders' constant movement made them a familiar sight in the town.

meanings.definition: To move restlessly or aimlessly from place to place.
meanings.sent1: The cat gadders around the house, never settling in one spot for too long.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he gadders through the streets, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The children gadders in the playground, playing tag and laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts gadders from one idea to another, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The wind gadders through the trees, rustling the leaves gently.
